facts: Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood.
A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance.
Honeybees communicate directions to food by doing a waggle dance.
Cheetahs are the fastest land animals, reaching about 60 to 70 miles per hour in short bursts.
Dolphins use echolocation, sending out clicks to find objects by listening for echoes.
Giraffes have the same number of neck vertebrae as humans, but each one is much longer.
Sea otters often hold hands while resting so they do not drift apart.
